formalText: James is off and she's pretty sure he's worried about her ability to be alone for a few weeks.
He sort of asked why she's sad.
She's not going to tell him she'd rather be dead.
She feels like he's taking care of her in so many ways that he wants from her or that he needs for her is for her to be okay, and she can't get them up.
It went through her head that this is the best way she can take care of him is to take care of herself, but then she can't take care of herself.
It seems like there's a similarity there, like he makes her be alive and that's something a part of her can really get behind and is really committed, and part of her can't.
She's committed to being but what she's trying to do a large chunk of her doesn't want to do that.
But when she doesn't spend any time with it, she's beginning to feel like nothing she does is authentic.
She can tell about the terrible, self-destructive things and feelings, but her attitude towards them has to be of one wanting to be better.
She's not sure how she feels about James leaving, but it'll be nice to have time alone.
